image.altText: sign saying yass valley council on a red brick building

props.synopsis: The Yass Valley Council defers a decision on whether to raise rates by at least 40 per cent as it looks to make savings in various areas.

title.children: Yass Valley Council considering raising rates by up to 58pc

image.altText: the tail of a Qantas Boeing 767

props.synopsis: Three Liberal politicians have been delayed getting to Canberra for climate talks after a Qantas plane was forced to make an urgent landing at Adelaide Airport when crews noticed smoke in the cabin.

title.children: Plane bound for Canberra forced to turn back after smoke in cabin

image.altText: Proposed site of Russian Embassy in Canberra

props.synopsis: The lease was granted to Russia in 2008, but was withdrawn when parliament passed a new law citing ASIO advice that the planned embassy could pose a threat to national security.

title.children: Russia loses High Court battle with Commonwealth over embassy site

image.altText: A building sign that reads 'ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal'.

props.synopsis: An international student has been awarded $10,000 in compensation after a tribunal found she was unfairly evicted from her university accommodation after she made complaints about noisy students.

title.children: Student who complained about noise unfairly evicted from uni housing

image.altText: Chris Steel MyWay+

props.synopsis: The ACT government is seeking legal advice over the botched MyWay+ transport system, as the company tasked with rolling it out missed the deadline to complete the project.

title.children: ACT government seeks legal advice as contractor misses MyWay+ deadline

image.altText: A man with short blonde hair stands speaking, with a woman with long blonde hair standing behind him.

props.synopsis: To be the leader of the Canberra Liberals you need to be thick-skinned, have a lot of persistence, and be very confident — and if Mark Parton's first press conference in the role is anything to go by, he might just be the perfect fit.

title.children: Who is the ACT's new opposition leader that wants to 'leave shit behind'?

image.altText: A person holds a placard with the words 'release the files'

props.synopsis: As the longest government shutdown in US history winds up, a fresh bout of political infighting is brewing over the Jeffrey Epstein files.

title.children: Vote on releasing Epstein files set for next week as US shutdown ends

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The local share market takes another leg lower as labour force figures pour cold water on rate cut expectations. Look back on the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters.

title.children: ASX tumbles as stronger jobs figures quash rate cut prospects — as it happened

image.altText: a mani n a suit

props.synopsis: Tasmania's lower house has started debating an "order" to build the Macquarie Point stadium.

title.children: Debate begins for controversial Hobart stadium ahead of parliamentary vote

image.altText: A young girl placing a pink-coloured, gel sheet mask over her face

props.synopsis: A new skincare line for children by actress-turned-entrepreneur Shay Mitchell creates an online uproar, with many questioning the need for the products.

title.children: Actor's skincare brand for children labelled 'dystopian' and 'tone deaf'

image.altText: A man in black with a black hat holds a closed fist in the air as he sings into a microphone on a stage under lights.

props.synopsis: Rock royalty AC/DC power up the earthshaking riffs at the MCG, rattling Melbourne with low-level seismic recordings.

title.children: Melbourne thunderstruck as AC/DC rocks earthquake monitors

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Neo Nazi Thomas Sewell had been granted bail after a Supreme Court judge found he would not pose an unacceptable risk to the community.

title.children: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell granted bail by Victorian judge

image.altText: A blurred parking fine on the windscreen of a white car

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has won a four-year legal battle against an Adelaide council over a $104 parking fine.

title.children: SA woman wins $104 parking fine challenge after over $50k in legal costs

image.altText: a convertible red car

props.synopsis: A $120,000 Shelby Cobra Roadster is found among a dozen allegedly stolen vehicles during a police raid in central Victoria.

title.children: Rare convertible among dozen allegedly stolen vehicles found in raid

image.altText: A female medical specialist in an office with a female patient

props.synopsis: Some Australians are waiting more than six years to see health specialists, prompting doctors to warn that people are risking death while languishing on public waiting lists.

title.children: 'I've had to literally fight': Aussies waiting more than six years for specialist appointments

image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: The then-16-year-old stabbed the Queensland grandmother at a shopping centre in February last year as her granddaughter watched on.

title.children: Family 'fractured' by grandmother's murder as teenage killer sentenced

image.altText: Two F1 drivers standing on the grid before a race, with their team pricipal standing behind

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri says the Azerbaijan Grand Prix weekend was the worst of his racing career and has hinted McLaren team orders may have played a part in it.

title.children: McLaren orders part of 'perfect storm' that began Piastri's F1 form slump

image.altText: A woman walks on a path as snow falls at Mt Buffallo, Vic

props.synopsis: From heat, back to snow, fire danger and storm warnings – spring weather has given the country some serious whiplash. What's behind it?

title.children: What's behind Australia's weather whiplash

image.altText: A man holding a mayoral campaign sign with his face blurred next to a woman with red hair and a green hat

props.synopsis: Joanne Keune maintains the tourist says it was the best thing that happened to him in Townsville.

title.children: Candidate says lost tourist campaigned in exchange for lift to cruise ship

image.altText: A young fair man wearing a chain on the beach

props.synopsis: A coroner finds police used an unreasonable level of force during the fatal shooting of Sydney man Bradley Balzan, prompting sweeping recommendations to overhaul proactive policing practices in NSW.

title.children: Police officer shot Sydney man dead after 'chaotic and desperate' struggle

image.altText: A man runs in a mountainous landscape.

props.synopsis: A documentary following a 20-year-old's epic 500-kilometre run over seven days is nominated for awards at six international film festivals.

title.children: Film documenting runner's gruelling trek through Blue Mountains goes global

image.altText: Four people including Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan sign the treaty

props.synopsis: Leaders and activists say they are feeling the gravity of Australia's first treaty with Aboriginal people being signed and formalised as law.

title.children: 'Over the moon': Aboriginal activists, leader celebrate historic treaty

image.altText: A Menulog food delivery bag with pies in plastic.

props.synopsis: The food delivery company is set to shut down on November 26. Here's what we know about the closure.

title.children: Menulog is closing down in Australia. Here's what we know

image.altText: A small hand holding a handful of blueberries

props.synopsis: The federal pesticide authority has updated how the chemical dimethoate can be used on berries after new data confirmed skyrocketing consumption has been putting young children over the safety limit.

title.children: Insecticide on berries found to exceed safe dose for children

image.altText: A portrait of a South Asian Australian woman in her early 30s, wearing a floral dress, smiling brightly.

props.synopsis: This year, Sukhjit Kaur Khalsa earned an Order of Australia medal and published her first book, Fully Sikh, all while running an indie theatre in Perth.

title.children: Sukhjit's poem about body hair took her to the Opera House stage and beyond

image.altText: Joyce DiDonato performs on a dark stage. One arm stretches forward and her eyes look up. She has a contemplative expression.

props.synopsis: Joyce DiDonato is one of opera's most in-demand mezzo-sopranos. She shares her passion for inclusivity and advocacy ahead of her first Australian tour.

title.children: 'Who says opera's boring?' Star US singer is an advocate of opera for all

image.altText: A side profile of Ms Hudson, with a minuture Qantas plane tail blurred in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has entered into an agreement with Qantas for a Product Innovation Centre that is expected to create more than 420 technology jobs by the end of 2028.

title.children: Hundreds of Qantas jobs to come to new innovation centre in Adelaide

image.altText: Houses being constructed on estate.

props.synopsis: The Help to Buy scheme will open to applicants soon. However, new research finds almost half a million households could be eligible for just 10,000 places in the co-ownership scheme.

title.children: Half a million households may qualify for federal co-purchasing scheme

image.altText: The symbol for meta is sitting on top of a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: The Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman wants to help Australians falsely locked out of social media accounts, but can't. Here's why.

title.children: Watchdog seeks powers to help those 'locked out of digital lives'

image.altText: Garth and Max 2

props.synopsis: Despite assistance dog Max wearing a vest and Garth Murray carrying his accreditation, they still faced illegal discrimination on a round-Australia charity walk, with one publican even calling the police on them.

title.children: Country pub calls police on army vet and his assistance dog

image.altText: Person in a green jumper fills a glass full of water from a kitchen tap.

props.synopsis: Councils are voting to remove fluoride from drinking water — so why did we add it in the first place, and how can you protect your teeth if you're losing access to it?

title.children: 'A repair tool': How fluoride in water helps strengthen teeth

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu standing with their faces very close to each other behind a podium

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has taken the extraordinary step of writing to Israel's President Isaac Herzog calling on him to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu of long-standing corruption charges.

title.children: Trump writes formal letter to ask for a pardon for Netanyahu

image.altText: woman in black blazer stands facing the camera

props.synopsis: The executive had a suspected stroke, went temporarily blind and was hospitalised five times after regularly clocking more than 100 hours a week on the job, according to documents filed with the Federal Court.

title.children: Woolworths executive worked more than 100 hours a week, lawsuit claims

image.altText: a black and white photo of two men talking into microphones

props.synopsis: Forty years ago the Wittenoom asbestos disaster changed Peter Gordon's life. Now he has come back to finish what he started.

title.children: Top lawyer returns to unfinished business in Wittenoom asbestos saga
